title: Why is my MMR so messed up?
body:
I am gaining +13 per win, losing -26 per loss. 

I appreciate if you lose matches that you should have won, your MMR tends to drop and you end up losing more elo than gain etc.

However, I have played 16 games over the past few days, I have won 12, lost 4. So how is my MMR not at least balancing? I appreciate that if I weren't doing well it wouldn't increase but I am consistantly getting A or S ranks, getting positive kdas (even in lost matches), and farming well. 

http://euw.op.gg/summoner/userName=MadBaron

It just seems a bit unfair, yeah you can have days where you do badly which can mess up your MMR but it shouldn't be a permanent hinder to your ranked experience, surely you should be able to pull it back and get to a stage where you gain and loss the same elo depending on whether you win or lose.

replies.body: Riot said they moved players into divisions where they shouldn't be, so they acknowledge its gonna backfire a little bit either in the game or in the forums. But they don't give a fk anyway so it doesn't matter.

The change over to the new tiers really messed up the MMRs of some people.

Before the change I was S4 and winning gave ~18lp and losing took ~18lp

After the change Im S4.... and Winning gives me 14-15LP and losing takes 20LP

Now OP.GG said my MMR was S1 so I think the change over took your MMR and not your rank.  But its really messed up on a lot of accounts because I was expecting to have more team mates that knew what they are doing but Im getting in almost every match someone who is not even Iron.   I mean like full on "Iv only played vs BOTS" kind of players.

It makes dodging VERY important.
op.gg cant see your real MMR, it just guesses.
Yeah I know, wasn't posting it for that, more just to prove I'm not just making up random facts.
